verses.verse: And Joseph<WH3130> was brought down<WH3381> to Egypt<WH4714>; and Potiphar<WH6318>, an officer<WH5631> of Pharaoh<WH6547>, captain<WH8269> of the guard<WH2876>, an Egyptian<WH376> <WH4713>, bought<WH7069> him of the hands<WH3027> of the Ishmeelites<WH3459>, which had brought him down<WH3381> thither.
And the LORD<WH3068> was with Joseph<WH3130>, and he was a prosperous<WH6743> man<WH376>; and he was in the house<WH1004> of his master<WH113> the Egyptian<WH4713>.
And his master<WH113> saw<WH7200> that the LORD<WH3068> was with him, and that the LORD<WH3068> made all that he did<WH6213> to prosper<WH6743> in his hand<WH3027>.

And Joseph<WH3130> found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in his sight<WH5869>, and he served<WH8334> him: and he made him overseer<WH6485> over his house<WH1004>, and all that he had<WH3426> he put<WH5414> into his hand<WH3027>.

And it came to pass from the time<WH227> that he had made him overseer<WH6485> in his house<WH1004>, and over all that he had<WH3426>, that the LORD<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> the Egyptian's<WH4713> house<WH1004> for Joseph's<WH3130> sake<WH1558>; and the blessing<WH1293> of the LORD<WH3068> was upon all that he had<WH3426> in the house<WH1004>, and in the field<WH7704>.

And he left<WH5800> all that he had in Joseph's<WH3130> hand<WH3027>; and he knew<WH3045> not ought<WH3972> he had, save<WH518> the bread<WH3899> which he did eat<WH398>. And Joseph<WH3130> was a goodly<WH8389> person, and well<WH3303> favoured<WH4758>.
And it came to pass after<WH310> these things<WH1697>, that his master's<WH113> wife<WH802> cast<WH5375> her eyes<WH5869> upon Joseph<WH3130>; and she said<WH559>, Lie<WH7901> with me.

But he refused<WH3985>, and said<WH559> unto his master's<WH113> wife<WH802>, Behold, my master<WH113> wotteth<WH3045> not what is with me in the house<WH1004>, and he hath committed<WH5414> all that he hath<WH3426> to my hand<WH3027>;

There is none greater<WH1419> in this house<WH1004> than I; neither<WH3808> hath he kept back<WH2820> any thing<WH3972> from me but thee, because<WH834> thou<WH859> art his wife<WH802>: how then can I do<WH6213> this great<WH1419> wickedness<WH7451>, and sin<WH2398> against God<WH430>?
And it came to pass, as she spake<WH1696> to Joseph<WH3130> day<WH3117> by day<WH3117>, that he hearkened<WH8085> not unto her, to lie<WH7901> by her<WH681>, or to be with her.

And it came to pass about this time<WH3117>, that Joseph went<WH935> into the house<WH1004> to do<WH6213> his business<WH4399>; and there was none of the men<WH376> <WH582> of the house<WH1004> there within.
And she caught<WH8610> him by his garment<WH899>, saying<WH559>, Lie<WH7901> with me: and he left<WH5800> his garment<WH899> in her hand<WH3027>, and fled<WH5127>, and got<WH3318> him out<WH2351>.
And it came to pass, when she saw<WH7200> that he had left<WH5800> his garment<WH899> in her hand<WH3027>, and was fled<WH5127> forth<WH2351>,

That she called<WH7121> unto the men<WH582> of her house<WH1004>, and spake<WH559> unto them, saying<WH559>, See<WH7200>, he hath brought in<WH935> an Hebrew<WH376> <WH5680> unto us to mock<WH6711> us; he came in<WH935> unto me to lie<WH7901> with me, and I cried<WH7121> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>: loud: Heb. great

And it came to pass, when he heard<WH8085> that I lifted up<WH7311> my voice<WH6963> and cried<WH7121>, that he left<WH5800> his garment<WH899> with me<WH681>, and fled<WH5127>, and got him<WH3318> out<WH2351>.
And she laid up<WH3240> his garment<WH899> by her<WH681>, until his lord<WH113> came<WH935> home<WH1004>.
And she spake<WH1696> unto him according to these words<WH1697>, saying<WH559>, The Hebrew<WH5680> servant<WH5650>, which thou hast brought<WH935> unto us, came in<WH935> unto me to mock<WH6711> me:
And it came to pass, as I lifted up<WH7311> my voice<WH6963> and cried<WH7121>, that he left<WH5800> his garment<WH899> with me<WH681>, and fled<WH5127> out<WH2351>.

And it came to pass, when his master<WH113> heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his wife<WH802>, which she spake<WH1696> unto him, saying<WH559>, After this manner<WH1697> did<WH6213> thy servant<WH5650> to me; that his wrath<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>.

And Joseph's<WH3130> master<WH113> took<WH3947> him, and put him<WH5414> into the prison<WH1004> <WH5470>, a place<WH4725> where the king's<WH4428> prisoners<WH615> were bound<WH631>: and he was there in the prison<WH1004> <WH5470>.

But the LORD<WH3068> was with Joseph<WH3130>, and shewed<WH5186> him mercy<WH2617>, and gave<WH5414> him favour<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the keeper<WH8269> of the prison<WH1004> <WH5470>. shewed: Heb. extended kindness unto him

And the keeper<WH8269> of the prison<WH1004> <WH5470> committed<WH5414> to Joseph's<WH3130> hand<WH3027> all the prisoners<WH615> that were in the prison<WH1004> <WH5470>; and whatsoever they did<WH6213> there, he was the doer<WH6213> of it.

The keeper<WH8269> of the prison<WH1004> <WH5470> looked<WH7200> not to any thing<WH3972> that was under his hand<WH3027>; because the LORD<WH3068> was with him, and that which he did<WH6213>, the LORD<WH3068> made it to prosper<WH6743>.
